column2: This law determines whether the realm is ruled by the monarch, a legislature, or both in tandem.
There are no legislative sessions and no restrictions on the monarch's power, other than how much the vassals are willing to take before they rebel.
The powers of the ruler are kept in check by a legislature of the nobles.
Nearly all the powers of the monarch have been assumed by the legislature.
Send messengers to all members of Congress requesting their presence.
I have given the orders for Congress to be convened in [Root.Location.GetName].
And all my vassals will be there...
